de.ntcomputer.minecraft.controllablemobs.api.ai.behaviors

Class AITargetNearest

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ntcomputer.minecraft.controllablemobs.api.ai.behaviors.AIBehavior<E>
      • de.ntcomputer.minecraft.controllablemobs.api.ai.behaviors.AITargetBehavior<LivingEntity>
        • de.ntcomputer.minecraft.controllablemobs.api.ai.behaviors.AITargetBehaviorEx
          • de.ntcomputer.minecraft.controllablemobs.api.ai.behaviors.AITargetNearest

  • public class AITargetNearest
extends AITargetBehaviorEx
    Target behavior: If this AIBehavior is added, the entity will search in its surroundings for an attackable target. You can adjust which entities should be attacked and which prerequisites should be fulfilled for a successful targeting.
    Version:
    v4
    Author:
    Cybran

        public AITargetNearest(int priority,
               double maximumDistance)
        Create with a custom priority and max range.
        Parameters:
        priority - the priority of this behavior. Specify 0 to auto-generate it
        maximumDistance - the maximum distance to search for enemies, in blocks. Default value is 16.0 blocks. If 0 is specified, the range is unlimited
        See Also:

      • AITargetNearest

        public AITargetNearest(int priority,
               double maximumDistance,
               boolean ignoreInvulnerability)
        Create with a custom priority and max range, specify invulnerability setting.
        Parameters:
        priority - the priority of this behavior. Specify 0 to auto-generate it
        maximumDistance - the maximum distance to search for enemies, in blocks. Default value is 16.0 blocks. If 0 is specified, the range is unlimited
        ignoreInvulnerability - if set to false, the entity will only attack vulnerable and visible targets. Default is false
        See Also:
        AITargetNearest(int, double, boolean, int, EntityFilter, Class...)

      • AITargetNearest

        public AITargetNearest(int priority,
               double maximumDistance,
               boolean ignoreInvulnerability,
               int maximumNoEyeContactTicks)
        Create with a custom priority and max range, specify more preconditions.
        Parameters:
        priority - the priority of this behavior. Specify 0 to auto-generate it
        maximumDistance - the maximum distance to search for enemies, in blocks. Default value is 16.0 blocks. If 0 is specified, the range is unlimited
        ignoreInvulnerability - if set to false, the entity will only attack vulnerable and visible targets. Default is false
        maximumNoEyeContactTicks - If set to a value greater than 0, the entity must have eye contact to its target to start attacking it. The value also describes, after how many server ticks without eye contact the entity will lose its current target. Default value is 60 = 3 seconds to lose its target, when the entity doesn't see it. If you specify 0, eye contact will be totally unnecessary
        See Also:
        AITargetNearest(int, double, boolean, int, EntityFilter, Class...)

      • AITargetNearest

        public AITargetNearest(int priority,
               double maximumDistance,
               boolean ignoreInvulnerability,
               int maximumNoEyeContactTicks,
               EntityFilter filter)
        Create with a custom priority and max range, specify more preconditions and provide entity filtering.
        Parameters:
        priority - the priority of this behavior. Specify 0 to auto-generate it
        maximumDistance - the maximum distance to search for enemies, in blocks. Default value is 16.0 blocks. If 0 is specified, the range is unlimited
        ignoreInvulnerability - if set to false, the entity will only attack vulnerable and visible targets. Default is false
        maximumNoEyeContactTicks - If set to a value greater than 0, the entity must have eye contact to its target to start attacking it. The value also describes, after how many server ticks without eye contact the entity will lose its current target. Default value is 60 = 3 seconds to lose its target, when the entity doesn't see it. If you specify 0, eye contact will be totally unnecessary
        filter - an EntityFilter to select only custom entities in range. If set to null, this argument is ignored
        See Also:
        AITargetNearest(int, double, boolean, int, EntityFilter, Class...)

      • AITargetNearest

        public AITargetNearest(int priority,
               double maximumDistance,
               boolean ignoreInvulnerability,
               int maximumNoEyeContactTicks,
               EntityFilter filter,
               Class<? extends LivingEntity>... targetClasses)
                throws IllegalArgumentException
        Create with the ultimate filtering settings!
        Parameters:
        priority - the priority of this behavior. Specify 0 to auto-generate it
        maximumDistance - the maximum distance to search for enemies, in blocks. Default value is 16.0 blocks. If 0 is specified, the range is unlimited
        ignoreInvulnerability - if set to false, the entity will only attack vulnerable and visible targets. Default is false
        maximumNoEyeContactTicks - If set to a value greater than 0, the entity must have eye contact to its target to start attacking it. The value also describes, after how many server ticks without eye contact the entity will lose its current target. Default value is 60 = 3 seconds to lose its target, when the entity doesn't see it. If you specify 0, eye contact will be totally unnecessary
        filter - an EntityFilter to select only custom entities in range. If set to null, this argument is ignored
        targetClasses - Only accept entities with any of the given classes as targets. Default value is [HumanEntity.class]. HumanEntity.class or Player.class handling performance is significantly optimized
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when targetClasses is specified as null or an empty array or it contains null.
